title: Godot Game Engine
desc: Godot is a 2D and 3D, cross-platform, free and open-source game engine released under the MIT license. Godot aims to offer a fully integrated game development environment. It allows developers to create a game from scratch, needing no other tools beyond those used for content creation (art assets, music, etc). Games using Godot can be created with a variety of programming languages including C++, C#, and any other language with GDNative bindings such as Rust, Nim, and D.

title: Svelte
desc: Svelte is a free and open-source JavaScript framework written by Rich Harris. Svelte applications do not include framework references. Instead, building a Svelte application generates code to manipulate the DOM, which may give better client run-time performance.
